_header: This little prose declareth in figure
Note: 18th-century transcript by Ainsworth [uncertain of which MS] is London, British Library Addit. 38179, f. 60v.
_description: John Lydgate, the Envoy to Lydgate’s prose Serpent of Division — three eight-line stanzas

CamFitzMc182.First Lines:
This litill prose declarith in figureThe grete damage and
                    distruccionThat whilome fill bi fatell auenturevn to Rome þe
                    myȝti riall towne…
CamFitzMc182.Last Lines:
…Remembrynge ay in yowre discrecionVppon pompey and cesar
                    Iulius

                        ed.  
             The Serpent of Division.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1910: 66; repr. Cohen (1915)
XCohen,  Helen Louise. 
             The Ballade.

CamMagPep2006.First Lines:
This litill prose declareth in figurethe grete damage and
                    destruccion…
CamMagPep2006.Last Lines:
…remembryng ay in your descrecionOf Pompeie and Cesar
                    Julius
